cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles (205 km) west of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Hispaniola and the Bahamas, then forecast to curve north-north-eastward along the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast or very near the northwest Bahamas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect for the north-western Bahamas (Andros, New Providence, Eleuthera, Abacos, Berry Islands, Grand Bahama Island, Bimini)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect for Puerto Rico, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, Dominican Republic coasts, northern Haiti coast, Turks & Caicos, south-eastern and central Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida through the Mid-Atlantic and New England within 5-day cone
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast totals generally 2–4 inches for Mid-Atlantic)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (minor 1–2 ft surge possible in Delaware Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Potential gusts 35–45 kt (40–50 mph) late Mon night–Tue as the storm’s core passes nearby
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible along Delaware Bay and tidal Delaware River around time of closest approach
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 2–4 inches causing localized urban and river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough Delaware River conditions, strong currents, and elevated river stages could interrupt cargo handling and vessel movements
